pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:0.4: 4. The training rule on fulfilling one’s own desires
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.2: At that time Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.4: One morning Udāyī robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the house of a beautiful widow,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.5: where he sat down on the prepared seat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.7: bowed down to him, and sat down to one side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.8: Udāyī then instructed, inspired, and gladdened her with a teaching.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.11: I’m able to give robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.12: “It’s not hard for us, Sister, to get those requisites.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.13: Give instead what’s hard for us to get.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.19: and she entered her bedroom, took off her clothes, and lay back on the bed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.23: That woman then complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.24: “These Sakyan recluses are shameless and immoral liars.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.25: They claim to live according to the Truth, to be celibate and of good conduct, to be truthful, moral, and of good character.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.26: But they don’t have the qualities of an ascetic or a brahmin;
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.28: How can the ascetic Udāyī request sexual intercourse from me, but then spit out, ‘Who would touch this foul-smelling wretch!’ and depart?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.29: What’s bad about me? How am I foul-smelling?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.30: In what way am I inferior to whom?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.8: “How can Venerable Udāyī commend the fulfilling of his own desires in the presence of a woman?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.9: Those monks rebuked Udāyī in many ways and then told the Master.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.10: The Master had the Order of monks assembled and questioned Udāyī,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.11: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you commended the fulfilling of your own desires in the presence of a woman?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.14: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a recluse, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.15: How can you commend the fulfilling of your own desires in the presence of a woman?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.16: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion, not for the sake of passion …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.17: for the stilling of the fevers of sense desire?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.18: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.19: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.20: ‘If a lustful monk encourages a woman to satisfy his own needs:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.21: “Sister, she provides the highest service who in this way satisfies one like me, who is virtuous, celibate, and of good character,” and if it is a reference to sexual intercourse, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.5: this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.17: his own sense desires, for the sake of himself, aiming at himself, satisfying himself.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.29: he is one of good character because of that virtue and because of being celibate.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.1: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.2: If the monk encourages the woman to satisfy his own needs, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.3: It is a woman, but he is unsure of it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.4: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a sexual non-conformist …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.5: It is a woman, but he perceives her as a man …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.6: It is a woman, but he perceives her as an animal, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.7: If the monk encourages the woman to satisfy his own needs, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.8: It is a sexual non-conformist, he perceives him as a sexual non-conformist, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.9: If the monk encourages the sexual non-conformist to satisfy his own needs, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.10: It is a sexual non-conformist, but he is unsure of it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.11: It is a sexual non-conformist, but he perceives him as a man …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.12: It is a sexual non-conformist, but he perceives him as an animal …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.13: It is a sexual non-conformist, but he perceives him as a woman, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.14: If the monk encourages the sexual non-conformist to satisfy his own needs, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.16: This section on “It is a man” is to be expanded as in [Saṅghādisesa 2, paragraphs 40–41](pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2#40).
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.17: It is an animal, he perceives it as an animal …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.18: It is an animal, but he is unsure of it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.19: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a woman …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.20: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a sexual non-conformist …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.21: It is an animal, but he perceives it as a man, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.22: If the monk encourages the animal to satisfy his own needs, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.23: It is two women, he perceives them both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.24: If the monk encourages both women to satisfy his own needs, he commits two offenses entailing suspension. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.25: to be expanded as in [Saṅghādisesa 2, paragraphs 45–53](pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2#45).
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.26: It is a woman and a sexual non-conformist, he perceives both as women, and he has lust.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.27: If the monk encourages both of them to satisfy his own needs, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.28: to be expanded as in [Saṅghādisesa 2, paragraphs 54–69](pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2#54).
